definition: ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
lit. newborn calves do not fear tigers (idiom)/fig. the young are fearless
pinyin: chu1 sheng1 niu2 du2 bu4 pa4 hu3

definition: (of a woman) to be fiercely protective of one's children
lit. the cow licking its calf fondly (idiom)/fig. to show deep affection towards one's children
lit. a new-born calf has no fear of the tiger (idiom)/fig. the fearlessness of youth
pinyin: chu1 sheng1 zhi1 du2 bu4 wei4 hu3

definition: see 初生之犢不畏虎|初生之犊不畏虎[chu1 sheng1 zhi1 du2 bu4 wei4 hu3]

definition: to abandon armed struggle and return to raising cattle (idiom)
Mt Baodu in Cangshan county 蒼山縣|苍山县[Cang1 shan1 xian4], Linyi 臨沂|临沂[Lin2 yi2], south Shandong
see 王八羔子[wang2 ba1 gao1 zi5]
lit. an old ox licking its calf (idiom)/fig. (of parents) to dote on one's children
the love of a cow licking her calf (idiom)/parental love

sentences.english: Calf diphtheria, is characterized by bilateral necrosis of the mucous membrane of the larynx.
sentences.chinese: 犊白喉，以喉粘膜的两侧性坏死为特征。

sentences.chinese: 犊来，交给仆人，仆人急忙预备好了。

sentences.english: The autumn-leaf-coloring plant is major tourist resources of Baodu mountarun.
sentences.chinese: 秋色叶树种是抱犊崮主要的秋季旅游资源。

sentences.english: Licking the calf of the love of the elderly, young persons are grateful heart.
